--- layout: component title: Tabs description: Tabs are used as a metaphor for file folder tabs of related content, the experience is consistent from tab to tab with content changing within each tab. They are modular and segmented containers within a single control that are helpful in grouping and displaying content while also having the ability to occupy less screen space. They can contain forms or other interactive elements but only if there is a clear call to action and if there is a way to reset the data (such as an interactive data visualization). guidelines: do: - Separate content into logical groupings - Identify each tab group with easily understood labels - Use when the content in each tab has a peer relationship - Use if tabs are meant to be accessed in a non-sequential manner - Use when space is limited dont: - Use for a single tab - Use for navigation - Use when there is a hierarchical relationship between the tabs - Use to represent different views of the same data - Use when the user needs to access information from multiple tabs simultaneously - Use if there is a need for more than 1 row of tabs - Use if the tab contents will require a longer loading time contents: - Usage guidelines - Basic tabs - Tab bar - Justified tabs ---
